description.narrative: (USAID Central Africa Regional): FY 2017 resources will directly support biodiversity conservation in the Virunga landscape to mitigate threats to biodiversity. Activities include improving management of protected areas, resolving human-wildlife conflicts, enforcing wildlife laws, combating wildlife poaching and trafficking, and supporting alternative livelihood activities. .USAID will use focused Sustainable Landscapes funds to implement activities that reduce deforestation and forest degradation and increase carbon sequestration. This effort will support the implementation of the national Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation strategy and action plan. Biodiversity funding will also indirectly support sustainable landscapes objectives by slowing deforestation and forest degradation. The benefiting countries are the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda.
